subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: The teenager Melanie Oudin has been chosen as the No. 2 player for the United States in the first round of its Fed Cup competition against Argentina this weekend in suburban Phoenix. Mary Joe Fernandez, the captain, picked Oudin, 17, of Marietta, Ga., over the U.S.T.A. pro tour veteran Julie Ditty. Oudin will make her Fed Cup debut against the No. 1 Argentine player, Gisela Dulko, on Saturday. The top American, Jill Craybas, will play Betina Jozami in the opening match in the best-of-five competition.
